Articles.Content: Since the .90 patch (on 32 bit windows and steam) either there has been a change as to how to make SAS operational or some prereq that wasn't stated in a way I understood. As you can see I've got an SAS installed on the rocket... I was under the impression you either needed a pilot OR a module to use the SAS (t key) function. Yet it only seems to work with pilots... when I throw engineers or scientists in I get the message I can't enable SAS because there's no sas AND no pilots (implying it should be an either or like I was under the impression of in the first place). I've tried this on more than just this craft as well with the same issue. (sorry the picture is huge and I didn't take the time to resize it)
The 'SAS' modules only provide reaction wheel torque now, you need a sufficiently advanced probe core or a pilot in order to use SAS.
Hmm, so it's all pilots doing my flights until I get upgraded to a multi-kerbal capsules then it seems. Thanks for the fast clarification

Hmm, so it's all pilots doing my flights until I get upgraded to a multi-kerbal capsules then it seems.

And I've got a ship about to attempt a landing on Eeloo that now doesn't have any SAS, apparently. That is a bummer. He flew a long way to spin wildly and crash, hehe.

Strange thing, when my 1-star Jeb tries to point pro- or retrograde using stock SAS, ship starts to tremble violently even though I'm out of atmosphere (reminds of FAR SAS tremble). Is it working as intended?
Hard to say. You might have too much SAS control authority on the vessel -- if you have any extraneous SAS modules, you might try removing them.
